capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-documented fact. I mean, it's not like he was just some random teacher who showed up one day and expected everyone to know him. No, he was a key figure in the school's history, and his connection to the Dark Arts made him a complex and intriguing character.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was a double agent working for the Order of the Phoenix while pretending to be a loyal Death Eater. It's hard to say whether his true loyalties were with the Dark Lord or against him.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was a double agent working for the Order of the Phoenix while pretending to be a loyal Death Eater. It's hard to say whether his true loyalties were with the Dark Lord or with Dumbledore and the wizarding world at large. But one thing's for sure, Snape's actions during that time were instrumental in helping us defeat Voldemort.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and had a significant impact on the students' education, but at the same time, his behavior towards Harry Potter was often quite... intimidating. He seemed to have a personal vendetta against Harry, which made it difficult for me to see him as just another teacher. I think that's why many people viewed him with suspicion, even though he did play an important role in the fight against Voldemort.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and had a significant impact on the students' education, but at the same time, his behavior towards Harry Potter and others was often quite... intimidating. (Sentiment: Neutral)
